patterns: Hi
Hello
Good day
Hey
responses: Hello, thanks for visiting
Good to see you again
Hi there, how can I help?
Please give more information

patterns: How can I raise an issue
I want to raise an issue
How to raise issue
responses: To raise an issue, please email support@squirro.com

patterns: Thanks
Thank you
That's helpful
responses: Happy to help!
Any time!
My pleasure

patterns: How do I search?
How to Search for firms
How do I search for documents
responses: Searching for documents is available via the home page in the main search bar

patterns: How do I find all documents related to my firm
How to see documents related to firms
How to search for firm's documents
responses: Type in the firm's name in the search bar and the next page will display all relevant results.

patterns: What is following?
What does following mean
responses: Following allows you to quickly perform searches on firms you are interested in

patterns: How do I follow my firms?
How can I folllow firms I'm interrested in
How do I follow a bank
How do I follow HSBC
responses: A list of firms can be found in the 'Firms' dashboard and the most related firm will appear in the main dashboards after searching for a particular term. This dashboard can be accessed by navigating to 'Firms' dashboard or by clicking on the settings icon in the main dashboard

patterns: Where can I find the query syntax
Where can I access the query syntax
Can I get the query syntax
Want to find list of quey syntax
responses: Full list of query syntax can be accessed from https://squirro.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DOC/pages/2949295/Query+Syntax

patterns: What is My Communities
What does Communities mean
responses: My Communities presents all firms or groups of firms you have chosen to follow

patterns: Does Squirro allow us to search on aliases
Can I search using aliases
Does Squirro accept aliases
responses: Yes! If you cannot find your firm's alias please contact xxx in Technology

patterns: How do I view my recent searches
How can I see my recent searches
Where can I find my recnt searches
responses: Click on View Latest Items in the landing page

patterns: How do I save my search?
How can I save my searches
I want to save my searches
responses: Searches can be saved by clicking on the heart icon near the main search bar

patterns: Where can I find structured Capital data on my firm?
Where can I find structured Liquidity data on my firm?
responses: Please see BSM or the SII systems, depending whether your firm is a Bank or an Insurer.

patterns: What does the timeline show
What is shown on the timeline
responses: The timeline displays the number of documents on each date for the search terms you have entered

patterns: How do I zoom in on the timeline
responses: Click on the timeline icon next to the gearwheel in the top right corner above the timeline graph

patterns: Is it secure?
Is Squirro secure
Is Squirro protected
responses: Yes. Squirro uses your email rights and documents rights

patterns: Can I see documents I do not have permission to?
I dont have access to a document
I can't view a document
Why cant I open a document
responses: FileSite security is applied, you can only view files you have permission to

patterns: What is latest items?
What does latest items mean
What does latest items show
responses: These are the most recent documents that have been uploaded to Squirro

patterns: I want to look by date
How do I select documents by date
Can I filter by date
responses: You can use the time view on the top right of the results page. Just move the cursor to select a specific time

patterns: How do I remove the timeline
How do I get rid of the timeline
How do I hide the timeline
How do I view timeline
responses: Click on the timeline icon next to the gearwheel in the top right corner

patterns: Is the date taken from the document?
Where is the date taken from
Does the document date come from FileSite
Where is the document date taken from
responses: The date comes from when the file was uploaded to FileSite

patterns: Why can't I search using FileSite folders?
How can I find file by folders?
Can I use folders to find documents
responses: Imagine when you search on Google, you don't use folders. You just type. This is the same approach.

patterns: What does significant terms show
What does significant terms mean
How can I view significant terms of a particular query ?
Where can I find the significant terms
responses: Significant terms shows most frequently mentioned terms in the body of documents related to your search. Significant terms are defined in the wordcloud within the main search dashboard.

patterns: What does the size of each significant term mean?
Does the size of the significant terms have meaning
responses: The size of each term shows the relative weight (frequency and significance) of the term in the body of documents. Larger sized terms demonstrate high frequency / significance and smaller ones - lesser.

patterns: How can I open documents?
I want to open documents
What does view in Filesite do
How do I download files
Can I download files
responses: Documents can be opened in their native format by clicking on the document title or the 'View in Filesite' button

patterns: I want to do a more advanced search
I want to do a deeper advanced search
I can't find what I'm looking for
None of the results seem helpful
None of the results answer my question
The results are not useful
responses: Advanced Search functionality is available by clicking on the magnifying glass with the plus sign

patterns: How do I apply filters
How do I apply filters by date
How do I apply filters by Word Document
How do I filter by email
How do I filter
How do I use filters
Can I filter by email
Can I filter by word document
I just want Excel documents
I just want PowerPoint documents
I just want Word documents
I just want PDF documents
responses: Select Filter options found on the left side window and select document type

patterns: How can I extract tables from PDF documents
responses: This can be achieved by selecting the table extraction button in the item view and then dragging over the area which contains the table

patterns: What can I extract from tables in PDF?
responses: You can extract the row and column names, as well as any datapoints present in an easy way requiring no formatting on your part

patterns: I would like to extract several tables from different PDFs?
responses: You can easily extract all tables in the population of documents and save them to the same Excel file for easy comparison.

patterns: How do I export?
responses: Just click on the top right and a little menu pops up. Select export to Excel

patterns: Can I save my searches?
Can I save my favourite documents
responses: Yes just click the heart

patterns: Why is it called Squirro?
responses: The name of the FinTech is Squirro. We quite like!

patterns: What is a widget
responses: It is a little application within Squirro that we think is helpful to the PRA

patterns: Why cannot I not find documents before 2019?
responses: It is a little application within Squirro that we think is helpful to the PRA

patterns: I've found a document that I think has the wrong permission
responses: Oh dear. Squirro just uses the FileSite permissions so perhaps they were not ideal. Why not talk to the author and get them changed?

patterns: How to sort search query by Date
How to sort search query by Relevance
How to sort search query by Smart Rank
responses: Squirro search results can be sorted by Date, Relevance or Smart Rank in the Advanced Options.

patterns: What is Smart Rank
What does Smart Rank mean
Smart Rank definition
Define Smart Rank
What is Smart Rank
responses: Smart Rank uses the combination of time and relevance to sort documents, therefore the most recent and most relevant documents appear first in the result list.

patterns: How do I clear a filter?
How do I remove the filters
responses: Filters can be cleared by selecting the button, "Clear Filters" or by navigating to the filter Icon in the bottom right hand corner

patterns: How can I unfollow firms?
I want to unfollow a firm
I want to stop following a firm
I want to stop following a firm
responses: Firms can be unfollowed by clicking on the "Unfollow" button from the Firms dashboards.

patterns: Who should I ask if I have a data problem?
responses: The PRA COO One Front Door is a good place to start for advice.

patterns: What is your favourite film?
responses: I, Robot.

patterns: How do I do specific terms?
responses: Just like google, you can use quotes around the text

patterns: What is a smart filter?
Define smart filter
What does smart filter mean
Smart filter definition
responses: Smart filters are intelligent, context-sensitive filters that following a little 'training' on a set of documents, can be used to identify most relevant and related information quickly

patterns: How do I create a smart filter?
How do I make a smart filter
How can I make a smart filter
responses: Please refer to this tutorial for a detailed step by step explanation. https://squirro.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DOC/pages/69009498/Smart+Filter+Tutorial#SmartFilterTutorial-CreateEmptySmartFilter

patterns: How can I improve my search results?
How do I improve my search results
How to improve my search
I want to improve my search results
responses: Have you tried using search operators or advanced search?

patterns: What are search operators?
Define search opeators
What does search operators mean
Explain what are search operators
responses: Just like in Google, search operators are logical connectors that instruct the search query to perform a particular function. The most common search operators are: Inclusion, Disjunction, Exclusion, Concatenation, Wildcard, Facet, and Near Search. See the link for definitions https://squirro.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DOC/pages/12156963/Basic+searching

patterns: What is autocomplete?
responses: This helps the tool and you learn. It is also handy so you don't have to retype things

patterns: How does it learn?
How does Squirro learn
responses: Just like google, with every search and interaction Squirro is learning. This helps us get better results

patterns: Will it learn my searches?
Will Squirro learn my searches?
responses: Just like google, it will learn what people are searching for and develop its artificial intelligence. If you like your search why not save it?

patterns: What are signals
What does signals mean
What does signal in the filter options mean
responses: Proximity filters that are a form of recommendation i.e Interest rate - Negative: Show documents that relate to negative interest rate.

patterns: Bye
See you later
Goodbye
responses: See you later, thanks for visiting
Have a nice day
Bye! Come back again soon.
